channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Government shutdown begins after Congress fails to agree on spending bill
item.description: Much of the federal government shut down Wednesday after Congress failed to reach a deal to keep government programs and services running before the midnight deadline.

item.title: Rep. Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., talks about the government shutdown
item.description: NPR speaks with Rep. Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., about the government shutdown.

item.title: After drone flights, NATO countries send troops to Denmark for EU leaders' meeting
item.description: After a week of flights by unidentified drones, the U.S. and other NATO countries sent troops and equipment to Denmark to protect its capital during meetings with European Union leaders Wednesday.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Government shutdown begins after Congress fails to reach a deal, federal workers brace for effects of shutdown, Trump tells gathering of commanders the military should be used against "enemy within."

item.title: Poll: Agreement that political violence may be necessary to right the country grows
item.description: On hot button issues, a majority say children should be vaccinated; controlling gun violence is more important than gun rights; and Epstein files should be released, in a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll.

item.title: Could the next Scarlett Johansson or Natalie Portman be an AI actor?
item.description: Hollywood is getting closer to signing up its first synthetic creation made with AI. SAG-AFTRA, the actors' union, is pushing back, concerned it could be a step toward replacing human talent.

item.title: Trump wants former British prime minister Tony Blair to help govern postwar Gaza
item.description: In President Trump's 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza, he named former British prime minister Tony Blair for a potential role in Gaza's postwar governance.

item.title: Scientists are breeding corals to withstand Florida's heat to combat climate change
item.description: Florida's current plans to restore the coral reefs won't work due to the impact of climate change, so scientists are trying something new: breeding corals that can better withstand heat.

item.title: Palestinian Authority official talks about Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza
item.description: Dr. Omar Awadallah, deputy minister of Foreign Affairs in the Palestinian Authority, talks about President Trump's 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza.

item.title: President Trump announces deal with Pfizer to sell its drugs on federal website
item.description: President Trump on Tuesday announced a deal with Pfizer to sell its drugs directly to consumers at discounted prices. They'll be available through a website operated by the federal government.
